coreCitation.description: Basic facts about the collection or dataset

title.description: Full name of the dataset or project

recordType.description: Used to distinguish between records describing collections, and records describing singular datasets

shortDataDescription.description: Short description of the dataset or project

shortGenealogyDescription.description: Used to note how the dataset described came to be, if it was inferred from or combined from other datasets

examples: This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

accessedViaURL.description: If the data has a record on a data portal, link to the whole record here

subjectTagging.description: Topic tags to facilitate search and filtering

otherSubjectAuthorities.description: Place to tag subjects based on authorities not formalized in this document

freeSubjectTags.description: Place for subject tags that don't conform to authority

temporalType.description: This field indicates whether the temporal extent of this dataset is expressed as a singular date, or as a range.

temporalNotes.description: Used to provide clarity about the temporal details of the dataset.

value.description: The value entered in this field should indicate the conceptual temporal extent the data represents. For instance, if the data depicts the state of the historic shoreline in 1916, but was created and published in 2019, the value of this field should be 1916. The 'datePublished' and 'temporalNotes' fields can be used together to provide any further clarification or nuance to the temporal details of the dataset.

The value entered in this field should indicate the conceptual temporal extent the data represents. For instance, if the collection is comprised of data depicting the various states of the historic shoreline between 1630 and 1995, but was created and published in 2019, the value of this field should be 1630. The 'datePublished' and 'temporalNotes' fields can be used together to provide any further clarification or nuance to the temporal details of the dataset.

The value entered in this field should indicate the conceptual temporal extent the data represents. For instance, if the collection is comprised of data depicting the various states of the historic shoreline between 1630 and 1995, but was created and published in 2019, the value of this field should be 1995. The 'datePublished' and 'temporalNotes' fields can be used together to provide any further clarification or nuance to the temporal details of the dataset.

dataBio.description: Background information about the who, what, where, why and how the data came to be, designed to place focus on human lives. If information about these fields is not available, these prompts can be used as conversation starters about why this information wasn't previously considered.

sampleSizeReasons.description: Explanation for this choice of sample size

knownProblems.description: Place to mention known problems or considerations related to sample size and method.

marginOfError.description: Place to knote considerations related to margins of error.

aggregationProblems.description: If there are known issues or considerations related to the way the data is aggregated, describe them here.

consent.description: Describe the degree to which the people included in this dataset knew about, agreed, and understood how their data would be used.

anonymization.description: If this data was masked or anonymized in any way, please describe that process here, including how measures of genuine privacy are being assured.

privacyIssues.description: Are there any known privacy issues or considerations related to this dataset?

whoIncluded.description: Explanation of who was included in this dataset

whoLeftOut.description: Explanation of who was not included in this dataset

whoCollected.description: Who was involved in collecting this data?

endDate.description: When did data collection wrap up?

whoConceived.description: Who is responsible for the conception of the collection project?

whoDesigned.description: Who designed the survey or data model?

whoExcluded.description: Who was excluded from the conception and design of the survey or data model?

representation.description: Were the communities who this data about included in the conception or collection process? If yes, please describe this process. If no, please explain why.

collectionConditions.description: Are there any known conditions surrounding the collection process which could have impacted results? For example, global pandemic, housing insecurity, documentation status, and so on.

collectorsLocations.description: Were the data collectors from the communities in which the data is being collected about?

collectionMethods.description: By which methods were the data collected?

fundingRequirements.description: Were there any requirements of funding that impacted this data at any point during the data information lifecycle?

originalPurpose.description: What was the original, state purpose for this data upon conception and acquiring funding?

potentialBenefit.description: If there are people who potentially benefit from this data, or have some stake in its quality, use this space to comment on who, how, and why.

potentialHarm.description: If there are people who potentially be harmed by this data, or have some stake in its quality, use this space to comment on who, how, and why.

vulnerability.description: If the populations included are typically undercounted or overcounted, please comment on how the data being publicly available could have an impact on them.

resourceConstellation.description: Datasets or data projects are often not useful on their own. Often, we need an entire constellation of supporting resources to make sense of the data we find. The information in this section can be added to as more learning materials become available.

suggestedEntryPoints.description: Reference to the most logical place for someone new to this dataset to begin to understand how to work with it

codebooks.description: Reference to any codebooks or data dictionaries intended to aid interpretation of the data's attributes or field names

publications.description: Reference to related analyses or prominent publications using the data

tutorials.description: Reference to guides, tutorials, Jupyter notebooks, or any resource with people-centered instructions on how to work with, use and understand this data

dataLifecycle.description: Human beings often make many changes to data during the process of trying to work with it and make sense of it. This section is aimed at painting a fuller picture of the actions other humans have performed on or about this data, to help you understand how you might want to use it.

acquisition.description: Used to describe where the data came from, if created from other data sources

ingredients.description: Used to provide relational links and notes about relationship quality regarding the 'ingredient' datasets this dataset was created from.

type.description: Was this ingredient alone improved upon to make the new dataset? (linearPredecessor) or was it combined with other datasets to make the new dataset? (compositeIngredient)

contextProvider.description: Person describing this dataset or project

contextOnBehalfOf.description: If the person filling out the context is different than the person responsbile for the creation or processing of the dataset or project, note that here

contextPublicationDate.description: Date this context was first made available

missingValuesNotes.description: In cases where fields were left blank because the contect contributr did not know the answer, this is a place for the contributor to name that, and possibly provide some information on why they think this information is not available.

missingGeneral.description: Are there any major issues with missing values in the data, and could you please comment on what and why

selectedFields.description: Array of metadata field names where the value provided in this context document should be elevated to high prominence in the discovery environment, to avoid important information being buried. Will vary dataset to dataset / project to project.

explanation.description: If you would like to, here is a place to provide an explanation of why you selected the fields you selected.

typicalUpdates.description: If this data is regularly updated, describe the typical nature of the changes

manipulation.description: Used to describe as clearly as possible the human choices involved in processing this dataset. The goal of the style of description should be that someone who has never encountered this type of data before could replicate all of the processing steps, start to finish. Steps can be entered chronologically, and paired with audio or image supplements to provide additional clarity.

shortDescription.description: A clear, sequential overview of all steps taken and the reasons for making changes or carrying out processing should be provided here.

droppedFields.description: General explanation if fields were dropped from the source data.

addedFields.description: General explanation if fields were added or inferred to the source data as part of these processing steps

successes.description: General explanation of how steps taken were beneficial to the improvement of this data for public use.

challenges.description: What was difficult about this project, known hangups, missing information, assumptions made, guesses, practical but questionable steps taken

sandtraps.description: Forewarnings or words-to-the wise for someone else wanting to work with this data or project

missingProcessingInformation.description: What is unknown about the process for cleaning, joining, analyzing, visualizing within this project that leaves meaningful gaps in understanding how to interpret or use it again

steps.description: Detailed information about each step in the processing sequence, explained in a way that someone else working with the starting data could perform the exact same steps and arrive at a similar result. This section is not tightly required, but is strongly suggested.

stepMotivation.description: Explanation of why this step advanced the overall goals of improving the dataset for use, why was it necessary?

audioProvidingContext.description: If audio narratives describing information about this dataset is easier to capture than text, this field points to those audio files and provides context about them

imagesProvidingContext.description: References to screenshots or photos that lend additional context about the dataset or steps taken to process the data
